notes: Maksym Chernyak, 44, Ukrainian parolee. Entered US Aug 2024. Arrested Jan 26 at Broward County Jail for battery. Transferred to Krome Feb 2. Hospitalized Feb 18 for vomiting/seizures. Died Feb 20 of brain hemorrhage at HCA Kendall Hospital. Third ICE death under Trump 2.0. Medical experts questioned delayed 911 response.

Juan Alexis Tineo-Martinez, 44-year-old Dominican Republic national. Taken into custody Feb 20 following maritime interdiction suspected of narcotics/human smuggling. Reported leg pain, transferred to Centro Medico Hospital in San Juan. Died March 3, 2025. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths).

Brayan Rayo-Garzon, 27-year-old Colombia national, died in ICE custody at Phelps County Jail, Rolla. Cause: found_unresponsive. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

hospital: Long Term Acute Care Hospital, El Paso
notes: Nhon Ngoc Nguyen, 55-year-old Vietnam national, died in ICE custody. Died at Long Term Acute Care Hospital, El Paso. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Marie Ange Blaise, 44, Haitian woman. Apprehended Feb 12 at St. Croix airport attempting to board flight to Charlotte. Issued expedited removal. Transferred to Broward Transitional Center April 5. Complained of chest pains hours before death. Pronounced dead 8:35pm April 25. Congresswomen Wilson and Cherfilus-McCormick visited facility May 2, condemned 'inhumane' conditions - single doctor for hundreds of detainees.

facility: In transit from Lowndes County Jail to Stewart Detention Center
notes: Abelardo Avelleneda-Delgado, 68-year-old citizen of Mexico, became unresponsive during transport from Lowndes County Jail to Stewart Detention Center and was pronounced deceased on May 5, 2025. Cause of death is under investigation. ICE notified the Mexican Consulate and relevant oversight bodies.

Jesus Molina-Veya, 45-year-old Mexico national, died in ICE custody at Stewart Detention Center, Lumpkin. Died at Phoebe Sumter Hospital, Americus. Cause: suicide. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

facility: Federal Bureau of Prisons FDC Miami
notes: Johnny Noviello, 49-year-old Canada national, died in ICE custody at Federal Bureau of Prisons FDC Miami. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Isidro Perez, 75-year-old citizen of Cuba, died in ICE custody at Krome Service Processing Center. He was pronounced deceased at HCA Kendall Florida Hospital on June 26, 2025, at 8:42 p.m. after reporting chest pains. Cause of death is under investigation. He was arrested on June 5, 2025, and had pre-existing medical conditions.

Tien Xuan Phan, 55, Vietnamese national. Arrested June 2 by ERO. Had removal order from 2012. In custody 7 weeks at Karnes County. Hospitalized July 18 for seizures, vomiting, unresponsiveness at Otto Kaiser Memorial Hospital. Airlifted to Methodist Hospital Northeast. Died 5:48pm July 19. Second Vietnamese death in ICE custody in 2025. 10th overall death of the year.

Chaofeng Ge, 32-year-old China national, died in ICE custody at Moshannon Valley Processing Center. Cause: suicide. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Lorenzo Antonio Batrez Vargas, 32, Mexican national known as 'Lenchito'. Arrested Aug 2 in Flagstaff for felony drug paraphernalia. Transferred to ICE custody. Pronounced dead Aug 31 at Mountain Vista Medical Center, Mesa. Cause unknown. Central Arizona facility exceeded capacity in 2025. 14th ICE death of the year.

Oscar Rascon Duarte, 58-year-old Mexico national, died in ICE custody at Eloy Detention Center. Died at Banner Desert Medical Center. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

hospital: Victor Valley Global Medical Center, Victorville
notes: Ismael Ayala-Uribe, 39, former DACA recipient from Westminster, Orange County. Brought to US age 4. DACA denied renewal 2016. Arrested Aug 17 by CBP, transferred to Adelanto Aug 22. Reported severe abdominal pain, buttock abscess, fever for weeks - requests for care ignored. Referred to hospital Sept 21, died 2:32am Sept 22 of sepsis. Family sued GEO Group and Wellpath Jan 2026. First California ICE death of 2025.

Francisco Gaspar-Andres, 48-year-old Guatemala national, died in ICE custody at Camp East Montana. Died at local hospital. Cause: liver_kidney_failure. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Dalvin Francisco Rodriguez from Nicaragua was found without a pulse at a Pennsylvania detention center on Dec. 4, 2025, and pronounced dead 10 days later (Dec. 14). His death was part of a deadly month in ICE custody.

Shiraz Fatehali Sachwani, 48-year-old Pakistan national, died in ICE custody. Died at hospital. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Nenko Stanev Gantchev, 56-year-old Bulgaria national, died in ICE custody at North Lake Processing Center, Baldwin. Cause: natural_causes_suspected. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Jean Wilson Brutus, 41-year-old Haiti national, died in ICE custody at Delaney Hall detention facility. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Fouad Saeed Abdulkadir, 46-year-old Eritrea national, died in ICE custody at processing center. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Geraldo Lunas Campos, 55-year-old Cuba national, died in ICE custody at Camp East Montana, Fort Bliss. Cause: homicide_asphyxia. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Victor Manuel Diaz, 36-year-old Nicaragua national, died in ICE custody at Camp East Montana, Fort Bliss. Cause: presumed_suicide. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Huabing Xie, Chinese national. First arrested Dec 31, 2023 near Tecate, released on own recognizance. Rearrested Sept 12, 2025 in Indio. Experienced seizure at Imperial Regional Detention Facility at 2:13pm Sept 29, became unresponsive. CPR and AED administered. Transported to El Centro Regional Medical Center, pronounced dead 3:15pm. 23rd official ICE death of FY 2025. Fifth Asian detainee death. Imperial facility struggling to hire medical director.

Luis Gustavo Nunez Caceres, 42-year-old Unknown national, died in ICE custody at Joe Corley Processing Center. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Luis Beltran Yanez-Cruz, 68-year-old Unknown national, died in ICE custody at Imperial Regional Detention Center. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Parady La, 46-year-old Unknown national, died in ICE custody at Federal Detention Center (FDC) Philadelphia. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).

Heber Sanchez Dominguez, unknown age-year-old Mexico national, died in ICE custody at Robert A. Deyton Detention Center. Cause: found hanging unresponsive. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).
jurisdiction_notes: Location of Robert A. Deyton Detention Center (Clayton County).

notes: Renee Nicole Good, 37-year-old unknown nationality national, died in ICE custody at unknown facility. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

notes: MANUALLY VERIFIED: NBC comprehensive investigation lists this specific incident with name, date, location, and details. Alex Pretti, 37-year-old unknown nationality national, died in ICE custody at unknown facility. Part of 2025 being deadliest year in ICE custody since 2004 (31+ deaths). 95% of ICE detention deaths could have been prevented with adequate medical care (PHR report).
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

notes: Genry Donaldo Ruiz-Guillen, 29-year-old Honduran national, died at Larkin Community Hospital after being detained at Krome. Suffered from rhabdomyolysis (muscle breakdown leading to kidney failure). Had been hospitalized since Dec 9, 2024. Mother said he complained of fainting spells in his last call. Part of pattern of deaths at Krome facility.

Serawit Gezahegn Dejene, 45-year-old Ethiopian national, died at Banner University Medical Center. Death related to untreated HIV - experts said routine blood tests would have immediately shown HIV and death was 'entirely preventable'. Hospitalized since Dec 23, 2024. Eloy Detention Center has at least 16 reported deaths including 5 suicides.

facility: Nassau County Correctional Center, East Meadow
cause_of_death: Liver failure complicated by alcoholism (disputed by family)
notes: Dead within 18 hours of being placed in detention. Medical professionals said it would be 'highly unusual' for someone with liver failure not to show symptoms 18 hours before death. NY Attorney General investigating.
Scheduled for deportation on December 13, the day before his death was officially pronounced. Found without pulse on December 4.

Shot at close range after dropping children off at school. Bullet traveled through back of neck to chest. Cook County Medical Examiner ruled homicide. Single father of two boys (ages 6 and 3). No criminal history - only traffic violations. Bodycam footage contradicts DHS claims he dragged agents. Mexican President called for investigation. Body repatriated to Michoacan.
jurisdiction_notes: Chicago suburb under Illinois TRUST Act.

notes: Border Patrol agents spotted several people in camouflage walking north from border. During apprehension, physical altercation ensued. Agent reported being in fight and needing help. Three gunshot wounds inflicted. Occurred during suspected narcotics smuggling operation. Texas Rangers investigating.

medical_condition: Hypertensive crisis (blood pressure 226/57) documented before transport
outcome: Death during transport from jail to detention center
outcome_detail: Avellaneda-Delgado died May 5, 2025 during transport from Lowndes County Jail to Stewart Detention Center by TransCor (CoreCivic subsidiary). Pronounced deceased by Webster County Coroner at 1:25 PM ET. Medical records show blood pressure of 226/57 (hypertensive crisis/stroke-level) before release. Webster County Coroner stated 'When the ambulance got there, he was dead. He was cold to the touch, so he had been dead.' Forensic pathologist Dr. Kris Sperry confirmed it takes 30-45 minutes for body to become 'cool to touch.'
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Major discrepancies: TransCor told 911 'medical department cleared him for travel, no noticeable medical conditions.' Yet EMS records showed stroke-level blood pressure. Acting ICE director Todd Lyons said 'We have nothing to hide' but official death report omits cause of death or medical detail. Family said he had no prior health conditions. Senators Warnock and Ossoff demanded answers. Arrested April 9, 2025 by Echols County Sheriff for probation violation.

cause_of_death: Cardiac arrest from alcohol withdrawal symptoms
outcome: Death 10 days after detention, family not notified until deathbed
outcome_detail: Gabriel Garcia-Aviles died October 23, 2025 - just 10 days after transfer to Adelanto following Costa Mesa arrest. Beloved community member, family man with work permit, lived in US over 30 years. When daughter arrived, found him 'unconscious, intubated, and with dried blood on his forehead.' ICE only notified family when he was on deathbed. Federal lawmakers demanded answers in December 23, 2025 letter to DHS Secretary Noem and ICE Director Lyons.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Second Adelanto death in 2025 (after Ayala-Uribe). ICE missed deadline to release death report. ICE stopped paying outside medical providers since October 3, 2025 - 'no mechanism to provide prescribed medication' or 'pay for medically necessary off-site care.' No dialysis, prenatal care, oncology, chemotherapy. Population ballooned from <40,000 in January to 73,000+.

sources.name: KVCR News / LA Taco / CBS Los Angeles

notes: Josue Castro Rivera, 24-year-old Honduras national. Was heading to gardening job when vehicle pulled over by ICE on I-264. Was in vehicle with 3 others. Fled onto busy highway when agents began detaining occupants. Struck by Ford pickup truck. ICE did NOT have a removal order for him. Had no criminal record. Had been in US 4 years.
jurisdiction_notes: Virginia has no statewide policy. Norfolk generally cooperative.

notes: Jaime Alanis Garcia, 57-year-old Mexico national. First known death during Trump ICE raid. Fell 30 feet from Glass House Farms cannabis greenhouse roof while hiding/fleeing. Broke neck, died after 3 days on life support. DHS says he was not "pursued" but family says he was hiding. ~200 arrested in raid, 10 minors found. GoFundMe raised 50k+.
jurisdiction_notes: Ventura County. Site of ICE detention facility deaths.

notes: Felix Baukholt, German national on expired H1B visa. Traffic stop for immigration inspection. Female companion Teresa Youngblut opened fire "without warning," killing both Baukholt and Border Patrol Agent David Maland. Couple had been observed in tactical gear at hotels.
jurisdiction_notes: Under Vermont Act 69. Rural area near Canadian border.

notes: Keith Porter, 43-year-old US citizen and African-American father of two. Shot on New Year's Eve by off-duty ICE agent Brian Palacios. DHS claims Porter was firing celebratory shots with rifle and pointed weapon at agent. Family disputes account. No charges filed against agent.
jurisdiction_notes: LA neighborhood. Under California Values Act.

notes: Hasan Ali Moh'D Saleh, 67, Jordanian national. Lived in US since 1994 but lost permanent residency after fraud convictions. Deportation ordered 2020. Detained Sept 2025 in Pompano Beach, transferred to Krome. Had history of heart disease. Died Oct 11, 2025 from cardiac arrest. 17th ICE custody death in 2025.
jurisdiction_notes: Ended sanctuary policy 2017 after state law.

name: Parady La
outcome_detail: Died from drug withdrawal in ICE detention; family accused ICE of medical neglect, saying he was begging for help in final hours
notes: January 2026: Parady La, 46-year-old Cambodian refugee, died from drug withdrawal in ICE detention in Philadelphia. La's family accused ICE of medical neglect, saying they were told he was begging for help in the final hours of his life.
jurisdiction_notes: City policy in neutral state. Executive Order 2016.

name: Cuban man (unnamed)
outcome_detail: ICE initially reported suicide; witness said he was choked by guard; medical examiner ruled homicide
notes: Geraldo Lunas Campos, 55, Cuban national, died Jan 3, 2026 at Camp East Montana following altercation with guards. Autopsy ruled homicide due to asphyxia from neck and torso compression while being physically restrained. Witnesses saw him become unresponsive while restrained by at least 5 guards.

name: Geraldo Lunas Campos
cause_of_death: Asphyxia due to neck and chest compression (homicide)
outcome_detail: Preliminary cause: asphyxia due to neck and chest compression, suggesting homicide. Occurred at military base detention facility.
notes: January 3, 2026: Geraldo Lunas Campos, 55-year-old Cuban migrant, died at Camp East Montana on Fort Bliss military base. Preliminary cause of death reported as 'asphyxia due to neck and chest compression,' suggesting homicide ruling pending toxicology results.
jurisdiction_notes: Military base used for migrant detention. Federal jurisdiction on base.

name: Victor Manuel Diaz
outcome_detail: Died of 'presumed suicide' at Camp East Montana tent complex. At least third death at the facility.
notes: January 14, 2026: Victor Manuel Diaz, 36-year-old Nicaraguan national, died of 'presumed suicide' at Camp East Montana tent complex at Fort Bliss. This was at least the third death reported at the facility.
jurisdiction_notes: Military base used for migrant detention. Federal jurisdiction on base.

name: Francisco Gaspar-Andres
outcome_detail: First death at Camp East Montana. Died from liver and kidney failure. Facility documented to have violated 60+ federal standards in first 50 days.
notes: Francisco Gaspar-Andres, 48, Guatemalan national. Arrested Sept 1 in FL, transferred to Camp East Montana Sept 19. Treated for various ailments Sept-Nov. Hospitalized Nov 16 for low sodium, intubated Nov 21, placed on liver transplant list and dialysis. Died Dec 3, 2025. First death at Camp East Montana facility.
jurisdiction_notes: Military base used for migrant detention. Federal jurisdiction on base.

name: Jean Wilson Brutus
outcome_detail: Died at University Hospital Newark following medical emergency at detention facility. Had entered ICE custody only the day before after arrest for criminal mischief.
notes: December 12, 2025: Jean Wilson Brutus, 41-year-old Haitian man, died at University Hospital Newark following medical emergency at Delaney Hall Detention Facility. He had entered ICE custody only the day before, on December 11, 2025, after being arrested for criminal mischief.
jurisdiction_notes: Mayor Ras Baraka publicly defied ICE Jan 2025.

name: Hasan Ali Moh'D Saleh
legal_status: Former lawful permanent resident (lost status after fraud convictions)
outcome_detail: 67-year-old Jordanian man arrested Sept 14 in Pompano Beach, transferred to Krome. Transported to Larkin Community Hospital Oct 10 due to fever. Found unresponsive Oct 11 at 6:32pm, CPR initiated. Died at 7:13pm. 17th ICE custody death in 2025.
notes: Hasan Ali Moh'D Saleh had significant medical history including hypertension, heart disease, renal disease and diabetes. Had been US LPR since 1994, lost status after 2018 fraud convictions. Deportation order issued 2020. 911 calls from Krome doubled in 2025 vs prior year.
jurisdiction_notes: Ended sanctuary policy 2017 after state law.

facility: Montgomery Processing Center / Valley Baptist Medical Center
outcome_detail: 72-year-old Filipino man died at Valley Baptist Medical Center after multiple hospitalizations. Entered US as LPR in 1962. Arrested Feb 25, 2025. Hospitalized multiple times Jul-Nov for anemia, septic shock, pneumonia.
notes: Pete Sumalo Montejo had criminal history including 1992 child sexual assault conviction. Detained at Montgomery Processing Center from Feb 25. Hospitalized May 2 for shortness of breath, discharged Jun 30. Multiple hospitalizations Jul-Nov for various conditions including anemia and septic shock from pneumonia. ICE notified OIG, OPR and Philippines consulate per policy.
jurisdiction_notes: Texas - strong cooperation with federal immigration enforcement.
